page.title: 07Knatts Valley in the N Downs
page.content:
{Knatts Valley}lies to the west of the A20, running from{Farningham}in the north to just south of{West Kingsdown.
This delightful valley is typical of the rural character of{North Downs countryside. The valley floor and lower slopes are cultivated with a variety of{cereal crops, rape and {grazing meadow.} Higher up the valley, the valley sides are crested with {deciduous woodland.
There is virtually no unsightly development, despite the presense of {agricultural buildings.}Where{housing does intrude, at the head of the valley, it is sparse and well shielded by the woods
The best{view of the valley}can be got from the A20, climbing{Death Hill.
